result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Virginia Ramirez-Andrade is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Liesl Monroy.
Defendant failed to appear on the last review date.  Defendant has complied with all of the conditions of the DPA.  State is willing to keep the agreement in place and moved to dismiss this case.
Court ordered case dismissed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub appeared in court after the case was called.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the trial court for sentencing upon return on the bench warrant

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel informs the court that he thought the court set this on Wednesday and that may be why his client is not here.
Case rescheduled to 08/17/2016 at 08:30 am., for a review hearing.
  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Ruth Garcia.
Defendant is complying with the deferred prosecution agreement.
Case adjourned for a final review in Branch 36.
  Review hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Brenda Bartholomew.
There is no report for this defendant because she failed to do her initial appearance with Marilyn Booker.
Court ordered case adjourned for a short adjournment.  Defendant is to bring in proof of all of the programs that she has attended on the next court date.
Case adjourned for another review hearing in Branch 36.
  Review hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Alexandria Wirth.
cab
The case is calendared for a final pretrial. 
The parties have come to an agreement in this case. 

As to count 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  
The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of one year.
The Defendant agrees to complete certain conditions within 12 months.  If the Defendant completes these conditions, the State will move to dismiss this case.  If the Defendant does not complete the conditions, the State will  proceed with the prosecution of this case.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Court adjourned for a review hearing in Branch 36.
. 
Court modified the no contact to no violent contact.
. 
Jury trial date of 10/05/2015 vacated.

  Review hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virginia Ramirez-Andrade in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for final pre-trial.  State informs Court that case should be assigned to Branch 23, due to the assignment of the Asst. District Attorney.  Court orders case transferred to Branch 23 and adjourned for final pre-trial.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Kremers, BRANCH 36, in Room 502 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEM dob 11/25/08 and DCM dob 5/26/10 unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
